tutorial.title: Destination Page
tutorial.descriptionContent: Use semantic elements to build a simple travel destination page and clearly define the contents of the page

executableContent.instructions:
Let's use our semantic HTML knowledge to create a simple travel destination page.

1. Code a `title` element inside of the `head` element with the title, `Travel Destiny`.

Now let's add the header to display our site's introductory content.

1. Code a `header` element directly inside the `body` element 
2. Code an `h1` element directly inside the `header` element. Add the text `Travel Destiny`
3. Code an `h2` element beneath the `h1` to display the tag line `Your Travel Destination Source`.

files.name: index.html
files.solvedContent:
Travel Destiny

Your Travel Destination Source

hints.title: Hint
hints.content: Create a header using the `<header></header>` tags.

executableContent.instructions:
Next, we want to create our navigation links to link to other pages.

1. Code a `nav` element under the `h2` element, still inside of `header`.
2. Code an `a` element directly inside the `nav` element. Add an empty `href` attribute with the value `""`, and the text `Destinations`.
3. Code a second `a` element directly inside the `nav` element. Add an empty `href` attribute and the text `Contact`.

files.name: index.html
files.content:
Travel Destiny

Your Travel Destination Source
files.solvedContent:
Travel Destiny

Your Travel Destination Source

Destinations Contact

hints.title: Hint
hints.content: Create a nav using the `<nav></nav>` tags.

executableContent.instructions:
Let's add the main content to this page.

1. Code a `main` element directly after the `header` element.
2. Code a `p` element directly inside the `main` element.
3. Add the text below inside of the `p`.  Code a `quote` element around the text `The Best Travels for the Best Prices.`. Check the hints to see how the quote element looks.
```
Our Motto is: The Best Travels for the Best Prices.
```

files.name: index.html
files.content:
Travel Destiny

Your Travel Destination Source

Destinations Contact
files.solvedContent:
Travel Destiny

Your Travel Destination Source

Destinations Contact

Our Motto is: The Best Travels for the Best Prices.

hints.title: Hint
hints.content: Create a quote element *inside* the `p` by using the `<q></q>` tags.

executableContent.instructions:
Now, we want to add an image to work as our banner.

1. Code an `img` element directly after the `p` element. 
2. Make its width `200`.
3. Set the source to `"https://mimo.app/i/eiffel.png"`.
4. Add an `alt` attribute with the value `"Eiffel Tower"`.

files.name: index.html
files.content:
Travel Destiny

Your Travel Destination Source

Destinations Contact

Our Motto is: The Best Travels for the Best Prices.
files.solvedContent:
Travel Destiny

Your Travel Destination Source

Destinations Contact

Our Motto is: The Best Travels for the Best Prices.

hints.title: Hint
hints.content: Create an image using the `` tag. Set the width of the image with `width=""`.

executableContent.instructions:
Next up, we want to create a section of the page that shows the destinations the site offers.

1. Code a `section` element inside the `main` element, after the `img` element. 
2. Code an `h3` element directly inside the `section` element. Add the text `Our Destinations`.

files.name: index.html
files.content:
Travel Destiny

Your Travel Destination Source

Destinations Contact

Our Motto is: The Best Travels for the Best Prices.
files.solvedContent:
Travel Destiny

Your Travel Destination Source

Destinations Contact

Our Motto is: The Best Travels for the Best Prices.

Our Destinations

hints.title: Hint
hints.content: Create a section using the `<section></section>` tags.

executableContent.instructions:
Let's save some space on the page by hiding the list of destinations unless the user wants to see them. 

1. Code three `details` elements under the `h3` inside of the `section`.
2. Inside each `details` element, code a `summary` element.
3. Type `Asia` inside of the first `summary`, `Europe` inside of the second `summary`, and `US` inside of the third `summary`.

files.content:
Travel Destiny

Your Travel Destination Source

Destinations Contact

Our Motto is: The Best Travels for the Best Prices.

Our Destinations

Our Destinations

Asia
Europe
US

executableContent.instructions:
We will be adding a list of destinations to our main locations which will be hidden unless the user wants to see them.

1. Create an unordered list with the items, `Japan` and `Korea`, under the `summary` with the text `Asia`.
2. Create an unordered list with the items, `France` and `Spain`, under the `summary` with the text `Europe`.
3. Create an unordered list with the items, `California` and `New York`, under the `summary` with the text `US`.

files.content:

Your Travel Destination Source

Destinations Contact

Our Motto is: The Best Travels for the Best Prices.

Our Destinations

Asia
Europe
US

executableContent.instructions:
Next, we want to display information on how to book a destination.

1. Code another `section` element directly after the first one.
2. Add an `h3` header directly inside of the section. Add the text `Booking`.

executableContent.instructions:
Let's add the contact information to let people know how to contact the company.

1. Code an `address` element below the `h3` element and still inside of the `section` element.
2. Add the text below inside the `address` element and wrap the text `RSVP` with the `abbr` element. 
```
RSVP your trip by calling 888-888-8888 or email bookings@traveldestiny.com
```

hints.title: Hint
hints.content:
1. Create an `address` element using `<address></address>` tags.
2. Create an `abbr` element using `<abbr></abbr>` tags.

executableContent.instructions:
Now let's display the company's customer service hours at the bottom of the page.

1. Code a `footer` element directly after the `main` element and before the closing `body` tag.
2. Code a `p` directly inside of the `footer`.
3. Add the text `Customer Service Hours: 5:00 AM - 11:00 PM` inside the `p` element. 
4. Code two `time` elements, one around the text `5:00 AM`, and another around `11:00 PM`.
